summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from August 2019 regarding the weekly Epstein Significant Activity Report (SAR). It provides a status update on victim outreach and services, reporting that 24 victims had been contacted (17 in New York, 7 in Miami) and that services were being coordinated for 5 more.

events.title: Weekly Epstein SAR Victim Status Update
events.description: Internal FBI email chain requesting and providing a status update on victim outreach and services for the Epstein case as part of the weekly Significant Activity Report.

keyFacts: As of August 22, 2019, the FBI had spoken to and offered services to 24 victims in the Epstein case (17 in New York, 7 in Miami).
Services offered to victims included interview assistance, crisis counseling, media information, and counseling referrals.
The FBI was in the process of speaking to and coordinating services for 5 more victims at the time, with two in Miami, one in New York, and two on the west coast.
The document indicates the FBI was producing a weekly Epstein Significant Activity Report (SAR) to track victim outreach and services.
